Package huffify

Class HuffmanTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • huffify.HuffmanTree
  • public class HuffmanTree
extends java.lang.Object

    HuffmanTree

    This class has the purpose to hold all the information about the Huffman Tree, to build it based on a passed as a parameter PriorityQueue and create codes for each character in the text.

    Author:
    mehai

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HuffmanTree​(java.util.PriorityQueue<HuffNode> pQueue)
      Initializes the root to null and builds the tree using buildTree method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> buildCodes()
      Builds the codes for each character in the text by using the recursive method traverseTree and a StringBuilder.
      HuffNode getRoot()
      Returns the root of the tree.
      void traverseTree​(HuffNode root, java.lang.StringBuilder code, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> map)
      Traverses the tree in a preorder fashion (root-left-right).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HuffmanTree

        public HuffmanTree​(java.util.PriorityQueue<HuffNode> pQueue)
        Initializes the root to null and builds the tree using buildTree method.
        Parameters:
        pQueue - PriorityQueue to use to build the tree.

    • Method Detail

      • buildCodes

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> buildCodes()
        Builds the codes for each character in the text by using the recursive method traverseTree and a StringBuilder.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing the characters and their codes as strings.

      • traverseTree

        public void traverseTree​(HuffNode root,
                         java.lang.StringBuilder code,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> map)
        Traverses the tree in a preorder fashion (root-left-right). It adds a "0" to the StringBuilder every time it goes left and a "1" every time it goes right. When the root is a leaf, it puts the character and the code in the HashMap. At the end of every call of the function, the last added character to the StringBuilder is removed.
        Parameters:
        root - root of the HuffmanTree.
        code - StringBuilder used to create each code.
        map - HashMap in which codes will be stored.

      • getRoot

        public HuffNode getRoot()
        Returns the root of the tree.
        Returns:
        the root of the tree.
